events.name: Accelerate app pipeline automation and app deployment with Docker and Jenkins

venue.name: Oficinas Tuenti
venue.address_1: Calle Gran Via, 28  (entrada Calle Valverde, 2) Madrid (mapa)

events.description:
Hay que apuntarse https://www.meetup.com/es-ES/Docker-Madrid/events/243199680/?eventId=243199680&chapter_analytics_code=UA-48368587-1

CI/CD is quickly becoming a must for organizations, large and small. Learn and see in action how Docker containers, container orchestration, and Jenkins platform simplify and accelerate its adoption and help teams reliably streamline application delivery. October's Meetup SCHEDULE 18:30 Check-in / Social, pizzas & drinks.

18:45 Welcome and introduction by Luis Herrera (Docker Captain).

19:00 Scaling Jenkins with Container orchestration by Carlos Sanchez. Carlos will demo how the Jenkins Kubernetes plugin runs agents on Kubernetes, using pipelines, multi-container agents, and other advanced features to scale and accelerate code pipelines.

Carlos Sanchez specializes in software automation, from build tools to Continuous Delivery following the DevOps philosophy. He has spoken at several conferences around the world, including ApacheCON, JavaOne, Fosdem,… Involved in Open Source for more than ten years, he is the author of the Jenkins Kubernetes plugin and a member of the ASF amongst other open source groups, contributing to several projects, such as Jenkins, Apache Maven, or Puppet. He works at CloudBees scaling the Jenkins platform. 20: 00 Building CI/CD pipelines with Docker DTR and Jenkins by Fernando Pereiro. Fernando will demo how to build and use a CI/CD pipeline for a demo app using the latest features of Jenkins and Docker DTR ( vulnerability scanning and image promotion)

Fernando Pereiro has been working for more than a decade in the world of design, development and software integration for large enterprises; CI/CD passionate and believer of a better world full of Docker containers, Jenkins and DevOps automation, he is currently working as a Cloud Solutions Architect and Development Consultant. 20:50 Surprise Raffle About Docker: Docker is an open platform for developers and sysadmins to build, ship, and run distributed applications. Consisting of Docker Engine, a portable, lightweight runtime and packaging tool, and Docker Hub, a cloud service for sharing applications and automating workflows, Docker enables apps to be quickly assembled from components and eliminates the friction between development, QA, and production environments.

events.name: GDG Cloud Madrid S01E04 - Supercarga tu app con Cloud Functions de Firebase
events.description:
Workshop práctico 

Supercarga tu app con Cloud Functions de Firebase

Duración de workshop 1 hora

En este workshop práctico vamos a codear una Cloud Function desde 0, desplegarla con firebase-cli a Google Cloud Platform y ejecutarla con un evento que generarán nuestros usuarios de FriendlyChat, un chat en Android serveless que configuraremos en directo.

Nota: - La herramienta de Firebase para desplegar la Cloud Function requiere Node.js 6.3.1 o superior. Asi que necesitarás tenerlo instalado asi como su gestor de paquetes, npm para el workshop.

- Puedes descargar el código del FriendlyChat de Github.$ git clone https://github.com/firebase/friendlychat-android

Bio: Paola Garcia. Software Engineer. Building communities in Chefly and OpenSource Weekends. Diversity Advocate in tech events.

events.name: GDG Cloud Madrid Season 2 Episode 1
events.description:
Tensorflow para frontend and Deep Learning with Apache Spark

Bienvenidos al primer episodio de esta nueva temporada!!!

Este meetup lo co-organizamos con los compañeros del meetup de Machine Learning Spain y compartimos espacio, ponentes y cerveza ;-)

Esta es la programación que tenemos programada:

18:30 - Acceso/registro al auditorio de Campus Madrid y Cerveza fresquita

19:00 AbadIA: Call For Action.

¿Conoces la AbadIA del crimen?¿Te lo pasaste a pelo o miraste las instrucciones? @VigasocoSDL nos ha picado y ya estamos haciendo un DQN para que lo juegue. ¿Te apuntas?

19:15 Mi app con Machine Learning para no datasciences

Recientemente se han liberado a la comunidad frameworks y servicios que nos permiten experimentar fácilmente con la potencia de la inteligencia artificial y el machine learning.

El objetivo de la charla es contar una breve introducción a Machine Learning para situarnos, como funciona, en qué consiste y qué uso podemos darle en nuestras aplicaciones.

Analizaremos con un ejemplo real muy visual cómo construir una aplicación con Inteligencia artificial, viendo lo fácil que es aprovechar el potencial de TensorFlow (plataforma Open Source de Google), interactuando desde FireBase e implementando la lógica con Cloud Functions.

By

Rubén Chavarri (Fullstack Developer, en Kairos)
Soy Rubén Chavarri, estudié ingeniería informática en Bilbao y participante de un programa de emprendimiento en EEUU colaborando en proyectos entre la Universidad y empresas. Ahora estoy viviendo en Madrid, centrado en Arquitecturas Front y tecnologías innovadoras. El tiempo libre lo dedico a emprender iniciativas, relacionadas con proyectos sociales, innovación o experiencias interactivas como www.partyrocking.tv.

https://twitter.com/pekewake

David Chavarri (Software Architect, en BBVA)

Soy David, ingeniero informático de Bilbao. Justo después, me involucré en un programa de innovación y emprendimiento, pasando 3 años en USA. En este tiempo participé en una startup relacionada con tecnologías VoIP y tecnologías interactivas. Hace 4 años volví a Madrid para trabajar en iniciativas relacionadas con la transformación digital como Arquitecto Software dentro de una empresa financiera. En mi tiempo libre continuó cultivando mi carácter emprendedor, asistente frecuente de charlas y meetups, y en cuanto tengo la oportunidad, aprovecho para compartir lo emprendido.

https://twitter.com/dvdchavarri

20:00- Deep Learning con Apache Spark by Favio Vázquez

Spark, defined by its creators is a fast and general engine for large-scale data processing.

Why would you want to do Deep Learning on Apache Spark?

- Apache Spark is an amazing framework for distributing computations in a cluster in an easy and declarative way. Is becoming a standard across industries so it would be great to add the amazing advances of Deep Learning to it.

- There are parts of Deep Learning that are computationally heavy, very heavy! Distributing these processes may be the solution to this another problems, and Apache Spark is the easiest way I could think to distribute them.

In this talk I will describe Deep Learning Pipelines. An open source library created by Databricks that provides high-level APIs for scalable deep learning in Python with Apache Spark. And a little more ;)

Favio Vázquez is Data scientist, physicist and computer engineer. Love sharing ideas, thoughts and contributing to Open Source in Machine Learning and Deep Learning ;).

20:30 - ¡Cervezas y networking!

Nos vemos en Campus Madrid.
events.how_to_find_us: Auditorio Google Campus Madrid, calle de manzanares, 1

events.name: CloudFest 2018 (Powered by GCDC Madrid & GCDC Español)
Cloud Study Jam: Kubernetes
events.description:
What do I want to cover:
1. Kubernetes
2. Google CloudBuild
3. Container Registry
4. Docker Multistage - Secret management
5. Google Cloud Stackdriver
6. Google Cloud IAM together with Kubernetes
7. Environments - Production, staging, dev, review?
8. How to debug the cloud:
- Monitoring
- Kubernetes
- Logging

These topics will cover taking a application locally, deploy it to Kubernetes, building it on Cloud Build, inject a secret stored in Kubernetes, using Google Cloud Stackdriver to monitor it, having proper access control for employees, tactics for splitting apps up into environments, and how to debug when something goes wrong.

Attendees limit: 20
I find that it is the amount of people that max can be in the same room and do the same before it becomes either to split up or there is too many to help.

Preprequites:
Google Cloud account and verified
Docker installed and ready

Who should attend?
People that are working in a small startup and want to grow. These tools will help them continue their innovation pace while serving real customers.
People in a company that uses docker but still haven’t taken the jump using containers in production because of knowledge gap and lack of prior experience

What is the event:
The event will be a workshop. The workshop will be split into multiple subject that each will be introduced and showed on the main presentation, then each attendee should use the technique on their own computer. Attendees are suggested to experiment and click around. Each segment will be 20 min. I will go around everyone with any problem or question there may be.

What is the outcome?
After the workshop attendees will know how to take a application and deploy it to Google Cloud.
After the workshop all attendees should feel they have tried the full journey of how a setup can look like.

Schedule:
10:00 - 14:00 4 hours
10:00 Welcome and introduction
What are we going to cover and why is it important
10:10 Part 1
11:00 Break
11:10 Part 2
12:00 Break
12:05 Part 3
12:45 Lunch - Drink and Sandwich
13:10 Part 4
14:00 Summary - What did we learn

#Next19Extended

events.name: Edge computing & GPU Powered Machine Learning
events.description:
El próximo miércoles 24 de abril organizamos un nuevo meetup en colaboración con el grupo Machine Learning Spain en el Singular Hub de Madrid

AGENDA

19.00.
Bienvenida

19.10.
RAPIDS - GPU Powered Machine Learning, por Miguel Ángel Martínez, Deep Learning Solution Architect en nVidia.

Data science gives enterprises the power to analyze and optimize business processes, supply chains and digital experiences. But data preparation and machine learning workloads typically take a long time. In cases when time is of the essence, such as predicting demand for perishable goods, being able to speed up data science workflows is a significant advantage.

With RAPIDS, a new set of open-source libraries for GPUs, data scientists can accelerate their python toolchain with minimal code changes and drastically improve productivity, while achieving top-model accuracy.

19.45:
Edge computing: procesando datos sin navegar por la nube", por Moisés Martínez, ML Engineer at Sngular.

Actualmente existen millones de dispositivos que son capaces de recolectar información que es enviada, procesada y/o analizada en algún CPD en otro lugar del mundo aprovechando el concepto de cloud computing. Pero los diferentes dispositivos que recogen la información suelen tener potencia de cálculo suficiente para procesar y/o analizar los datos en el propio dispositivo sin necesidad de enviarlos. Además, en los últimos años, el aumento de privacidad sobre los datos recolectados por los diferentes sensores no puedan ser enviados para ser analizados.

En esta charla, describiremos el concepto de Edge Computing y sus diferencias sobre el cloud computing, además describiremos cómo funcionan los nuevos dispositivos Edge desarrollados por Google y qué podemos realizar con ellos actualmente.

20.30:
Networking & beers

¡Os esperamos a tod@s!

events.name: I/O Extended '19 Madrid
events.description:
El próximo martes 7 de mayo, nos reunimos en el Auditorio del Google for Startups Campus Madrid para ver en directo la retransmisión de la Keynote del I/O 2019, el mayor evento de Google del año.

La retransmisión comenzará a las 7pm, pero nuestro evento empezará antes porque lo vamos a "Extender" con uns presentación y varias charlas técnicas.

Al finalizar, tendremos un rato de networking y refrescos/cervezas por cortesía de Google y Campus.

#io19extended #io19

🗓AGENDA:

• 17:00 - Apertura de Puertas

• 17:30 - Presentación de las Comunidades Organizadoras

• 17:45 - "¿A qué no sabías que que tu navegador puede hablar?" por Jorge Baumann.
En esta charla exploraremos algunas funcionalidades/APIs del navegador. Descubriremos qué hacen, cómo las podemos usar y por qué son tan divertidas.

• 18:20 -"Funcionalidades Ocultas de Firebase y cómo usarlas en Producción" por Carlos Hernández

• 19:00 - Google I/O Keynote

• 20:40 - Networking & Drinks!

This is a series of monthly full-workshops on Google Cloud Platform (GCP) at Google For Startups Campus, covering from beginners to in-depth content on topics such as Machine Learning on Cloud, Security, Deployment of Applications, Certification and Kubernetes solutions.

Starting from an introductory level, we will be advancing in difficulty with the succeeding sessions. Attendees will be able to take training material home and continue from there with support.

events.name: Google Cloud Study Jam Online
events.description:
Cloud Study Jam Online is an on-line hands-on training event based on Qwiklabs. Along two days, in a 2 hours session each day, participants will complete a series of labs, covering one or several Google Cloud Platform topics related to Kubernetes. Even more, using Google Classroom, the participants will get follow-up support allowing them to extend the training to one month.

Event’s details

Date:
Nov 6th, 17:00 - 19:00

Nov 7th, 17:00 - 19:00

Location: On line

Calendar event: Use this link : http://bit.ly/2pV0RsE

Live Streaming session: use this link https://stream.meet.google.com/stream/83c02ccd-18b6-41e8-8fe9-d907279823b5

Trainer: almo, Google DevRel

Audience:
Developer, with no or little experience in Google Cloud Platform, willing to improve their skills Kubernetes and infrastructure development.

Target:
On - line: 60 attendees

Contents
In terms of contents, Cloud Study Jam offers high level of customization. In particular we could cover one or more topics, adjusting the level of expertise necessary.

Pre-Work
Using your gmail account
Sign up Classroom(https://classroom.google.com/) and join to the class-id qkjgda
Sign up Qwiklabs (https://www.qwiklabs.com/)
Do the lab “A Tour of Qwiklabs and the Google Cloud Platform” (https://www.qwiklabs.com/focuses/2794?parent=catalog)

Infrastructure
Getting Started with Cloud Shell & gcloud (https://www.qwiklabs.com/focuses/563?parent=catalog)
Creating a Virtual Machine (https://www.qwiklabs.com/focuses/3563?parent=catalog)
Orchestrating the Cloud with Kubernetes (https://www.qwiklabs.com/focuses/557?parent=catalog)
Continuous Delivery Pipelines with Spinnaker and Kubernetes Engine (https://www.qwiklabs.com/focuses/552?parent=catalog)

Additionally, introducing a section Next Steps, it is possible to forward those profile more senior to advanced topics.

Trainer info

Bio: Andres-Leonardo Martinez-Ortiz a.k.a almo is a member of the Google Engineering team, leading Google Cloud Ecosystem program in Europe. Based in Zurich, he drives the success of Google's developer products and the Open Web by creating a thriving ecosystem of developers. He meets with experts and partners in large companies, startups, universities and enterprises, promoting Open standards and Google technologies. He is also a member of IEEE, ACM, Linux Foundation and Computer Society.

@davilagrau

FAQ
Is this a lecture about Google Cloud?
No it is not. This is a hands-on event. Don’t expect to have presentations or lectures about the topics covered. But no need to worry! All the labs are self-contained and you will get content about the topics of the session before the training.

Is this a Q&A session? Will I get support about my projects?
No it is not. You won’t get support either. However, we will gather your questions, doing our best to get them solved.

Will I get access to Qwiklab after the event?
Yes, you will. The event offers one-month free subscription to Qwiklab. You can extend this free offer one additional month completing any of the quest available.

More info : https://blog.gdg.es/2019/10/proxima-formacion-online-sobre-google.html?m=1

organizers.name: Moisés M.
organizers.bio: PhD in Artificial Intelligence (Machine Learning and Automated Planning). Interested in robotics, Artificial Intelligence (IA), Machine Learning, algorithms, programing languages and videogames. T3chFest (t3f) organizer. Lead Data Scientist at beBee.
